children.text:
First, read n, then 3n integers. Sort the array. Compute the sum. Convert sum to string. Check for 'A' and 'B'. Now, code outline:

program main

  implicit none

  integer :: n, i, total_elements

  integer, allocatable :: array(:)

  integer :: res, head

  character(len=20) :: str

  logical :: hasA, hasB

  read(*,*) n

  total_elements = 3 * n

  allocate(array(total_elements)) do i = 1, total_elements

     read(*,*) array(i)

  end do

  ! Sort the array in ascending order using bubble sort

  do i = 1, total_elements -1

     do j = 1, total_elements -i

        if (array(j) > array(j+1)) then

           array([j, j+1]) = array([j+1, j])  !
children.label: high_level_plan

children.text:
Convert res to string

  write(str, '(I0)') res

  ! Check for 'A' and 'B'

  hasA = .false. hasB = .false. do i = 1, len_trim(str)

     if (str(i:i) == 'A') then

        hasA = .true.

     elseif (str(i:i) == 'B') then

        hasB = .true.

     end if

  end do

  if (hasA .and.
children.label: code_analysis

children.text:
hasB) then

     print *, 'Yes'

  else

     print *, 'No'

  end if

end program main

array(j+1) = temp

Because maybe the compiler doesn't support array sections for swapping.

Putting it all together.

Now, putting all steps into a single Fortran program.

First, read n, then 3n integers.

Sort the array.

Compute the sum.

Convert sum to string.

Check for 'A' and 'B'.

Now, code outline:

program main

  implicit none

  integer :: n, i, total_elements

  integer, allocatable :: array(:)

  integer :: res, head

  character(len=20) :: str

  logical :: hasA, hasB

  read(*,*) n

  total_elements = 3 * n

  allocate(array(total_elements))

  do i = 1, total_elements

     read(*,*) array(i)

  end do

  ! Sort the array in ascending order using bubble sort

  do i = 1, total_elements -1

     do j = 1, total_elements -i

        if (array(j) > array(j+1)) then

           array([j, j+1]) = array([j+1, j])  ! This is a swap using array section (Fortran 90+)

        end if

     end do

  end do

  ! Compute the sum

  res = 0

  head = 3*n -1

  do i = 1, n

     res = res + array(head)

     head = head -2

  end do

  ! Convert res to string

  write(str, '(I0)') res

  ! Check for 'A' and 'B'

  hasA = .false.

  hasB = .false.

  do i = 1, len_trim(str)

     if (str(i:i) == 'A') then

        hasA = .true.

     elseif (str(i:i) == 'B') then

        hasB = .true.

     end if

  end do

  if (hasA .and. hasB) then

     print *, 'Yes'

  else

     print *, 'No'

  end if

end program main

temp = array(j)

array(j) = array(j+1)

array(j+1) = temp

Because maybe the compiler doesn't support array sections for swapping. To be safe, perhaps better to use a temporary variable.

Another thing: the 'write(str, '(I0)') res' will write the integer as a string without leading spaces. The len_trim(str) will give the length of the string. The loop over each character is okay.
